DOC.detailed_description: The Fit Study three-year , cluster-randomized control trial evaluate impact school-based body mass index ( BMI ) screen report childhood obesity psychosocial outcomes . This study take place 2014-15 , 2015-16 , 2016-17 school year . Seventy-five school across California randomize one three group : 1 ) BMI screen reporting , 2 ) BMI screening , 3 ) BMI screen reporting ( control ) . Schools randomize Groups 1 2 conduct height weight measurement annually 3rd-8th grade student . Group 1 2 school also administer five fitness assessment ( mile run PACER test , curl-ups , push-ups , trunk lift , sit reach ) annually 5th-8th grade student . In fall Years 2 3 , Group 1 school mail report home parent student ' result previous spring . All 3rd 4th grade parent receive report BMI result . Investigators randomize parent 5th-8th grade student receive report provide BMI result one provide BMI result result five fitness assessment . Schools randomize Group 3 conduct height weight measurement student Years 1 2 . Each fall , investigator administer survey 4th-8th grade student school . This survey assess weight-based teasing , feeling stigmatization , weight-control behavior among student . The student survey also ask question student ' experience height weight measure school . In Years 1 2 , investigator mail survey home subsample parent assess parent behavior relate child 's physical activity nutrition , well parent reaction BMI report .
